variantrule.name: Werebat Player Characters
entries: A character that becomes a werebat gains a Dexterity of 17 if his or her score isn't already higher, blindsight (echolocation) with a range of 120 feet, a flying speed of 40 while in hybrid or bat form, and a +2 bonus to AC while in bat or hybrid form (from natural armour). Attack and damage rolls for the natural weapons are based on the character's Dexterity.

variantrule.name: Notes on the Equinoid Creature Type
entries: Equinoids are treated the same as Humanoids for most practical purposes. If a spell or ability says that it can target humanoids, then it can also target equinoids, and vice versa. That does not mean that they are strictly speaking the same type though. Humanoids are not Equinoids.

variantrule.name: Hearth's Warming
entries: The ritual of hearthswarming is an ancient Harmony rite to defeat windigos. It consists of singing about the joys of harmony and friendship. Performing the ritual correctly is much easier with more ponies present.
Performing the ritual requires a group performance check at {@dc 30}. The Difficulty class is reduced by one for each equinoid singing in the performance.

legendaryGroup.name: Chrysalis
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Chrysalis can take one of the following lair actions; he can't take the same lair action two rounds in a row:

items.name: Command
entries: Chrysalis casts the command spell on every creature of her choice in the lair. She needn't see each one, but she must be aware that an individual is in the lair to target that creature. She issues the same command to all the targets.

items.name: Conjure Mirrors
entries: Smooth surfaces within the lair become as reflective as a polished mirror. Until a different lair action is used, creatures within the lair have disadvantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide.

legendaryGroup.name: Ahuizotl
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Ahuizotl can take one of the following lair actions; he can't take the same lair action two rounds in a row:

items.name: Summon Guardians
entries: Ahuizotl summons 3 panthers from hidden areas of the temple.

items.name: Obscure Traps
entries: Creatures of Ahuizotl's choice within the lair have disadvantage on all checks and saving throws to find, detect or avoid traps until another lair action is used.

items.name: Escape!
entries: Ahuizotl teleports to the exit of the lair.

action.name: Poison Quill
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 5/60 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 1} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d8 - 1}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Back Facing Spines
entries: The puckwudgie's spines face backwards, giving it an edge in defense, but hindering its offense. It's poison quill attacks are always made at Disadvantage.

reaction.name: Back Facing Spines
entries: Whenever the puckwudgie is attacked in melee it can use a reaction to turn itself and have the attacker hit the spines, dealing 3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage and 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage.

Diminutive spined creatures, puckwudgies are extremely aggressive, but usually only pose a threat to the unprepared. There are stories of puckwudgies learning magic, or tricking ponies to steal food and shiny objects, but the common puckwudgie appears far too dim to pull anything like that off.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The ursa can move through other creatures as if they were {@quickref difficult terrain||3}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ursa makes two claw attacks and one bite attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d12 + 5}) force damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) force damage.

The Ursa Minor is a rarely encountered incorporeal bear like creature that has deep connections to the stars. There are rumors of even larger Ursa Majors, beings of immense stature that rise to the heavens they resemble, but sightings of such a monster have never been substantiated.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny insect. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points except through Consume.

trait.name: Musical Weakness
entries: Parasprites are attracted to and {@condition charmed} by music. They have disadvantage on all saving throws against Bard spells. In addition, anyone may attempt a Charisma check using a musical instrument contested by the Swarm's Intelligence. On a failure, the swarm is {@condition charmed} by the performer.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 4d4 + 2}) piercing damage if the swarm has more than half of its HP remaining. 7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) damage otherwise.

action.name: Consume
entries: The swarm consumes any crops or food inside its space. If its at full HP, this creates another identical swarm of parasprites. If it is at more than half HP, this heals it for 18 ({@dice 4d8}) HP. If it is at less than half HP, this heals it for 9 ({@dice 2d8}) HP.

Tiny round insectoids, Parasprites seem cute and harmless. They exploit this and their relatively cute appearance compared to most other insects, to gain access to pony settlements. Once a parasprite infestation has taken hold in a pony farming town its very difficult to remove, as they reproduce asexually and rapidly. Luckily, they are very sensitive to song, and bard spells tend to work very well in charming parasprites.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The maulwurf has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Physical Magic Resistance
entries: The maulwurf's thick hide gives it advantage on strength, dexterity and constitution saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The maulwurf makes two claw attacks and one bite.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d10 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) slashing damage.
Maulwurfs are burrowing creatures that resemble a cross between a star-nosed mole and a bear. They are extremely resistant to magical attacks.

trait.name: Rampage
entries: When the diamond dog reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on its turn, the diamond dog can take a bonus action to move up to half its speed and make a bite attack.

trait.name: Delver
entries: The diamond dog has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks while underground.

trait.name: Firearms Knowledge
entries: The diamond dog ignores the loading property of its musket.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The diamond dog makes two attacks one of which can be a bite.

action.name: Musket
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit +4} to hit, range 40/120 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d12+2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Frag Grenade {@recharge 5}
entries: The diamond dog throws a grenade up to 60 feet, and the grenade explodes in a 20-foot-radius sphere. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 17 ({@damage 5d6}) piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Diamond dogs are canine miners and slavers. Lazy and cruel, they tend to kidnap ponies to work in their mines. They're not stupid, having used elemental earth magic to both increase their mining efficiency and invent a form of gunpowder. But the laziness of their culture has invited stagnation.

trait.name: Rampage
entries: When the diamond dog reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on its turn, the diamond dog can take a bonus action to move up to half its speed and make a bite attack.

trait.name: Delver
entries: The diamond dog has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks while underground.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The diamond dog makes two attacks one of which can be a bite.

action.name: Pickaxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage. This attack deals double damage to objects.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Mining Explosive {@recharge 5}
entries: The diamond dog sets a mining explosive. At the start of his next turn, the dynamite explodes in a 20 foot radius sphere. Each creature in the area must make a DC13 dexterity saving throw, taking 11 ({@damage 3d6}) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Unattended objects in the area take double damage from the explosion.

Diamond dogs are canine miners and slavers. Lazy and cruel, they tend to kidnap ponies to work in their mines. They're not stupid, having used elemental earth magic to both increase their mining efficiency and invent a form of gunpowder. But the laziness of their culture has invited stagnation.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The sea serpent makes two attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tail Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Breath Weapon
entries: The sea serpent exhales a 30 ft. line of water. Creatures in the area must make a Strength saving throw (DC16). On a failure they take 14 ({@damage 4d6}) bludgeoning damage and are knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, they take half the bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The sea serpent can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The sea serpent deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Inherit Accuracy
entries: The slingtail's ranged attacks ignore cover. Being in melee range of an enemy doesn't give the slingtail disadvantage on its ranged attacks.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The slingtail makes 3 attacks, one of which can be a boulder throw.

action.name: Boulder Throw
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 90/300 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) damage. A flying creature hit by this attack must make a Strength saving throw {@dc 13} or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Stomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) damage against {@condition prone} targets.

trait.name: Stench (Hezrou)
entries: Any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the bufogren must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the start of its next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to any bufogren's stench for 24 hours.

trait.name: Keen Hearing
entries: The bufogren has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The bufogren can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The bufogren's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

action.name: Mutliattack
entries: The bufogren makes 3 attacks, one of which can be a tongue lash attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tongue Lash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.  A hit target is automatically {@condition grappled} by the bufogren. The bufogren cannot use this attack if it has a creature {@condition grappled} by its tongue.

action.name: Swallow
entries: The bufogren makes one bite attack against a Medium or smaller target it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target is also swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the target is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the bufogren, and it takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) acid damage at the start of each of the bufogren's turns. The bufogren can have only one creature swallowed at a time. If the bufogren dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 5 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Poison Breath
entries: The bufogren exhales poison gas in a 60 foot cone. All creatures within the area other than another bufogren must make a constitution saving throw ({@dc 15}). On a failure, they take 14 ({@damage 4d6}) poison damage and become {@condition poisoned}.

Frog-like creatures that dwell deep in the swamps of equestria, and are usually not interested in combat. They can often be bargained with for information, but enduring their stench makes this alone a challenge. That said, a Bufogren who was tricked or scammed makes for a dangerous enemy.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The timberwolf has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the timberwolf's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The timberwolf has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Sneak Attack
entries: The timberwolf deals an extra 7 ({@dice 2d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the timberwolf that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the timberwolf doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 11} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

Carnivorous plants in canine form, Timber Wolves stalk the deep forests of Equestria, preying on anypony they can catch. Organized into highly effective packs by their Alphas, outnumbered ponies have trouble dealing with these menaces. However, Timber Wolves fear fire. Even a simple torch will keep them at bay. Woodswise pony rangers will always keep a torch at hoof's reach for these ever present threats.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The alpha has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the alpha's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The alpha has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The alpha regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point. If the alpha takes fire damage this trait doesn't function at the start of the alpha's next turn.

trait.name: Sneak Attack
entries: Once per turn, the alpha deals an extra 14 ({@dice 4d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the alpha that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the alpha doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The alpha makes two bite attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) piercing damage.  If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}

action.name: Absorb
entries: The alpha can absorb another timber wolf to gain 10 HP, or the timber wolf's remaining HP, which ever is greater. This also gives the alpha resistance to fire damage for the rest of it's turn.

Carnivorous plants in canine form, Timber Wolves stalk the deep forests of Equestria, preying on anypony they can catch. Organized into highly effective packs by their Alphas, outnumbered ponies have trouble dealing with these menaces. However, Timber Wolves fear fire. Even a simple torch will keep them at bay. Woodswise pony rangers will always keep a torch at hoof's reach for these ever present threats.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The cragodile can breathe air and water.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cragodile makes two attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) piercing damage, and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape DC19).

action.name: Tail Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}30 ({@damage 4d12 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.
Cragodiles are massive aquatic reptiles that hide in rivers and wetlands as if they're small rocky islands, before ambushing their prey at the water's edge.

trait.name: Tunneler
entries: The wurm can burrow through solid rock at half its burrow speed and leaves a 10-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wurm makes three tentacle attacks.

action.name: Tentacles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d8 + 9}) bludgeoning damage, plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage. A hit creature is {@condition grappled} automatically by the wurm.

action.name: Swallow
entries: All Large or smaller creatures {@condition grappled} by the wurm must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw or be swallowed. A swallowed creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the tatzlwurm, and it takes 35 ({@damage 10d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the tatzlwurm's turns. If the tatzlwurm takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the tatzlwurm must succeed on a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the tatzlwurm. If the tatzlwurm dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 10 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Acid Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The wurm exhales acid in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw, taking 35 ({@damage 10d6}) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Subterranean snake-like creatures, Tatzlwurms have several tentacles in their mouths they use for grabbing prey. Tatzlwurms are known to carry diseases that while mild for the wurms, are devastating to other beings.

monster.name: Bug Bear
languages: Bug Bears can communicate via pheromones

trait.name: Multi-Armed Abomination
entries: The Bug Bear can make 2 reactions and object interactions per turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Bug Bear makes three attacks, two claw attacks and one Sting attack.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) slashing damage and the target must make a DC18 Dexterity (Acrobatics) or Strength (Athletics) ability check, or be {@condition grappled}. The Bug Bear can only grapple 2 creatures at a time.

action.name: Sting
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) piercing damage and the target must make a DC15 Constitution saving throw or take 22 ({@damage 5d8}) Poison damage, half on a success. This attack has advantage on a creature the Bug Bear has {@condition grappled}.

reaction.name: Honed Reflexes
entries: The bugbear can make a Claw attack in response to being hit with an attack.
Hybrid half bear, half wasp creatures, Bug Bears are full of malice and can use their multiple arms to dominate close quarters combat.

immune.note: from nonmagical attacks not made with silvered weapons

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The werebat can use its action to polymorph into a bat-equinoid hybrid or into a bat, or back into its true form, which is equinoid. Its statistics, other than its AC, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Keen Hearing
entries: The werebat has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing.

trait.name: Echolocation
entries: The werebat can't use its blindsight while {@condition deafened}.

trait.name: Sneak Attack
entries: Once per turn, the werebat deals an extra 18 ({@dice 6d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the werebat that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the werebat doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The werebat makes two attacks, one of which can be a bite.

action.name: Bite (hyrid or bat form only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.  If the target is a equinoid, it must succeed on a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw or be cursed with werebat lycanthropy.

action.name: Hoof Crossbow (equinoid form only)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit +5} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Hoof Blade (hybrid or equinoid form only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

bonus.name: Cunning Stealth
entries: The werebat can attempt to Hide or Disengage as a bonus action.

A werebat is a form of Equestrian lycanthrope. Often called Vampire Fruit Bats, the condition does cause a pony to take on a hybrid bat form, but has nothing to do with the common flying mammal nor the undead. Other forms of lycanthropy occur in Equus as well.

trait.name: Warrior of Sunlight
entries: Celestia's weapon attacks are magical. When Celestia hits with any weapon or spell attack, she deals an extra {@dice 6d8} radiant damage.

trait.name: Divine Awareness
entries: Celestia knows if she hears a lie.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Celestia's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 25}). She can innately cast the following spells, without need for material components.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Celestia makes two Longsword or Lightning Spear attacks.

action.name: Flying Sword
entries: Celestia releases her longsword to hover magically in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of it. If Celestia can see the sword, Celestia can mentally command it as a bonus action to fly up to 50 feet and either make one attack against a target or return to Celestia's hands. If the hovering sword is targeted by any effect, Celestia is considered to be holding it. The hovering sword falls if Celestia dies.

action.name: Healing Touch (4/day)
entries: Celestia touches another creature. The target magically regains 40 ({@dice 8d8 + 4}) hitpoints and is freed from any curse, disease, poison, blindness or deafness.

action.name: Lightning Spear
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 17} to hit, range 120/120 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 1d10 + 10}) lightning damage, plus 27 ({@damage 6d8}) radiant damage.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +15} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d8 + 8}) slashing damage, plus 27 ({@damage 6d8}) radiant damage.

legendary.name: Teleport
entries: Celestia magically teleports along with any equipment she is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet in any direction.

legendary.name: Searing Burst
entries: Celestia emits magical, divine energy. Each creature of her choice in a 10 foot radius must make a {@dc 23} Dexterity saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Blinding Gaze
entries: Celestia targets one creature she can see within 30 ft. of her. If the target can see her, the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until magic such as the Lesser Restoration spell removes the blindness.

trait.name: Warrior of Moonlight
entries: Luna's weapon attacks are magical. When Luna hits with any weapon or spell attack, she deals an extra {@dice 6d8} radiant damage.

trait.name: Divine Awareness
entries: Luna knows if she hears a lie.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Luna's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 21}). She can innately cast the following spells, without need for material components.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Luna makes two Glaive or Moonbow attacks.

action.name: Moonbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit +16} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d8 + 9}) piercing damage plus 27 ({@damage 6d8}) radiant damage. If the target is a creature that has 100 hit points or fewer, it must succeed on a {@dc 23} saving throw or die.

action.name: Crescent Moon Glaive
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 2d10 + 9}) slashing damage, plus 27 ({@damage 6d8}) radiant damage.

action.name: Healing Touch (4/day)
entries: Luna touches another creature. The target magically regains 40 ({@dice 8d8 + 4}) hitpoints and is freed from any curse, disease, poison, blindness or deafness.

legendary.name: Teleport
entries: Luna magically teleports along with any equipment she is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet in any direction.

legendary.name: Freezing Burst
entries: Luna emits magical, divine energy. Each creature of her choice in a 10 foot radius must make a {@dc 23} Dexterity saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) cold damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Blinding Gaze
entries: Luna targets one creature she can see within 30 ft. of her. If the target can see her, the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until magic such as the Lesser Restoration spell removes the blindness.

variant.name: Nightmare
entries: To transform Princess Luna into the Nightmare, Change her alignment to Lawful Evil, change the radiant damage she deals to necrotic, she gains Legendary Resistance and replace her healing touch with the following:

Voice of Fear (1/Day). The Nightmare utters a dreadful word of power. Each creature that can hear her must succeed on a {@dc 21} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} of her for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. A creature that saves against this effect is immune to his Fearful Voice for 24 hours.

trait.name: Assassinate
entries: During its first turn, the changeling has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn. Any hit the changeling scores against a {@quickref Surprise|PHB|3|0|surprised} creature is a critical hit.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the changeling is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the changeling instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The changeling can use its action to polymorph into a Small or Medium equinoid it has seen, or back into its true form. Its statistics, other than its speed, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Sneak Attack
entries: Once per turn, the changeling deals an extra 14 ({@dice 4d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the changeling that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the changeling doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The changeling makes two attacks.

action.name: Hoofblade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage and the target must make a DC15 Constitution saving throw, taking 17 ({@damage 5d6}) poison damage and becoming {@condition poisoned} on a fail, and taking half the poison damage on a success.

action.name: Hoofbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage and the target must make a DC17 Constitution saving throw, taking 28 ({@damage 8d6}) poison damage on a fail.

bonus.name: Cunning Action
entries: As a bonus action, the changeling may attempt to Hide, Disengage, or Dodge.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The changeling is an innate spellcaster, using Charisma (Spell Save {@dc 13}, Spell Attack Modifier +5) for the following spells.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The changeling is an innate spellcaster, using Charisma (Spell Save {@dc 11}, Spell Attack Modifier +3) for the following spells.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The changeling can use its action to polymorph into a Small or Medium equinoid it has seen, or back into its true form. Its statistics, other than its size and speeds, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The changeling makes two attacks, or casts {@spell emotion drain|mlpplaneshift} and then makes one attack.

action.name: Hoof Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4+2}) slashing damage.

monster.name: Dragonlord Torch

trait.name: Draconic Awakening (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If the dragonlord would be reduced to 0 hit points, its current hit point total instead resets to 425 hit points, it recharges its Breath Weapon, and it regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the dragonlord can now use the options in the "Mythic Actions" section for 1 hour. Award a party an additional 105,000 XP (210,000 XP total) for defeating the dragonlord after its Chromatic Awakening activates.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
entries: If the dragonlord fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragonlord makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 18} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 2d10 + 10}) piercing damage plus 13 ({@damage 2d12}) force damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 18} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d8 + 10}) slashing damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 20}) and is {@condition restrained} until this grapple ends. The greatwyrm can have only one creature {@condition grappled} this way at a time.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 18} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d8 + 10}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 26} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Breath Weapon {@recharge 5}
entries: The dragonlord exhales a blast of energy in a 300-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 26} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 40 ({@damage 6d12}) lightning damage and 40 ({@damage 6d12}) fire damage. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The dragonlord makes one Claw or Tail attack.

legendary.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The dragonlord beats its wings. Each creature within 30 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 26} Dexterity saving throw or take 17 ({@damage 2d6 + 10}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. The dragonlord can then fly up to half its flying speed.

legendary.name: Furious Bite (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The dragonlord makes one Bite attack with advantage. If the attack hits a creature, the target must succeed on a {@dc 26} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} of the dragonlord until the end of its next turn.

mythicHeader: If the dragonlord's Draconic Awakening trait has activated in the last hour, it can use the options below as legendary actions.

mythic.name: Bite
entries: The dragonlord makes one Bite attack.

mythic.name: Draconic Flare (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The dragonlord flares with elemental energy. Each creature in a 60-foot-radius sphere centered on the dragonlord must succeed on a {@dc 26} Dexterity saving throw or take 13 ({@damage 3d8}) lightning damage and 13 ({@damage 3d8}) fire damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The siren's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 20}, {@hit 12} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The siren can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Elemental Demise
entries: If the siren dies, its body disintegrates into a burst of water and foam, leaving behind only equipment the siren was wearing or carrying.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The siren makes three bite attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) piercing damage and 9 ({@damage 2d8}) cold damage.

action.name: Water Jet
entries: The siren magically shoots water from its mouth in a 60-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a target takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) bludgeoning damage and, if it is Huge or smaller, is pushed up to 20 feet away from the marid and knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, a target takes half the bludgeoning damage, but is neither pushed nor knocked {@condition prone}.

bonus.name: Liquid Magic {@recharge 5}
entries: The Siren uses its Spellcasting ability.

Sirens are from a different plane of existence than Equestria, and came here to use their powers of song based enchantment magic to control ponies to do their bidding. They feed on positive emotions, leaving behind only negativity. It is said that Starswirl and the Pillars banished a trio of evil Sirens

trait.name: Chilling Presence
entries: At the start of each of the windigo's turns, each creature within 15 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or take 7 {@damage 2d6} cold damage. For each minute a creature spends within 15 feet of the windigo, it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or suffer one level of {@condition exhaustion} from cold exposure. Unprotected, non-magical flames within 15 feet of the windigo are extinguished. Any spells of 3rd level or lower that provide resistance to cold damage and that are within 15 feet of the windigo immediately end. Water freezes if it remains within 15 feet of the windigo for at least 1 minute.

trait.name: Elemental Nature
entries: The windigo doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Rejuvination
entries: If the windigo is destroyed, it regains all its Hit Points in 24 hours unless the ritual of Hearth's Warming is performed over the remains.

trait.name: Snowsight
entries: The windigo can see through areas obscured by snowfall, sleet, rain, and other wintry precipitation without penalty.

In small numbers these elemental spirits of winter are dangerous, but they are remembered for the vast multitudes they roamed around in the early decades of Equestrian history. In numbers their power increases, and they feed on strife and conflict. The founding myth of Equestria centers on a group of ponies from different tribes who banded together and discovered the Hearth's Warming ritual that finally was able to destroy Windigos permanently.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The windigo makes two icy hooves attacks.

action.name: Icy Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) cold damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is knocked {@condition prone}.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Chrysalis casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 23}):

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Chrysalis fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Chrysalis has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Chrysalis makes two Wave of Sorrow attacks. She can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Wave of Sorrow (Rapier)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) force damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) acid damage.

action.name: Teleport
entries: Chrysalis teleports, along with any equipment she is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space she can see.

bonus.name: Change Shape
entries: Chrysalis transforms into a form that resembles a Medium Equinoid or back into her true form. Aside from her size, her statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment she is wearing or carrying isn't transformed.

reaction.name: Negate Spell {@recharge 5}
entries: Chrysalis tries to interrupt a spell she sees a creature casting within 60 feet of him. If the spell is 3rd level or lower, the spell fails and has no effect. If the spell is 4th level or higher, Chrysalis makes a Charisma check against a DC of 10 + the spell's level. On a success, the spell fails and has no effect.

legendary.name: You Belong to Me!
entries: Chrysalis casts {@spell dominate person} or {@spell dominate monster} without using a spell slot.

legendary.name: Sting!
entries: Chrysalis makes one Wave of Sorrow attack.

legendary.name: Dance, My Puppet!
entries: One creature {@condition charmed} by Chrysalis that Chrysalis can see must use its reaction to move up to its speed as Chrysalis directs.
The most feared of the Changeling Queens, utterly ruthless and pragmatic. She will do anything to rule over all changelings, and steal love from all other races.

trait.name: Magic Absorption
entries: Tirek is immune to force damage, and succeeds on all saving throws from spells. When Tirek succeeds on a saving throw from a spell he regains HP equal to that spell's level.

trait.name: Building Power
entries: Whenever Tirek consumes a spell of 3rd level or greater via his Consume Magic ability, he builds a power level.
At Power level 1, his Strength increases to 21. At level 2, he can use his Horn Beam attack. At level 3, all of his stats become 21 and he becomes Huge sized. At level 4+, he needs a new stat block.

action.name: Consume Magic
entries: A creature within 5 ft. of Tirek must make a Charisma saving throw, {@dc 17}. On a Failure, they lose their highest level spell slot. Tirek regains HP equal to the level of the spell slot lost. If the spell slot was at least level 3, Tirek builds a power level. (See Building Power above)

action.name: Punch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Stomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d8 + 1}) bludgeoning damage. Tirek can only use this against {@condition prone} creatures, or creatures two or more sizes smaller than him.

A centaur from a far off land who learned the ability to steal magic. He will not rest until all magic is his. This is his "base" form, and if he's able to get past Power level 4, he can become a society ending threat.

trait.name: Magic Absorption
entries: Tirek is immune to force damage, and succeeds on all saving throws from spells. When Tirek succeeds on a saving throw from a spell he regains HP equal to that spell's level.

trait.name: Building Power
entries: Whenever Tirek consumes a spell of 3rd level or greater via his Consume Magic ability, he builds a power level.
At Power level 1, his Strength increases to 21. At level 2, he can use his Horn Beam attack. At level 3, all of his stats become 21 and he becomes Huge sized. At level 4+, he needs a new stat block.

action.name: Consume Magic
entries: A creature within 5 ft. of Tirek must make a Charisma saving throw, {@dc 17}. On a Failure, they lose their highest level spell slot. Tirek regains HP equal to the level of the spell slot lost. If the spell slot was at least level 3, Tirek builds a power level. (See Building Power above)

action.name: Punch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Stomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. Tirek can only use this against {@condition prone} creatures, or creatures two or more sizes smaller than him.

A centaur from a far off land who learned the ability to steal magic. He will not rest until all magic is his. This is his "base" form, and if he's able to get past Power level 4, he can become a society ending threat.

trait.name: Magic Absorption
entries: Tirek is immune to force damage, and succeeds on all saving throws from spells. When Tirek succeeds on a saving throw from a spell he regains HP equal to that spell's level.

trait.name: Building Power
entries: Whenever Tirek consumes a spell of 3rd level or greater via his Consume Magic ability, he builds a power level.
At Power level 1, his Strength increases to 21. At level 2, he can use his Horn Beam attack. At level 3, all of his stats become 21 and he becomes Huge sized. At level 4+, he needs a new stat block.

action.name: Consume Magic

action.name: Punch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Stomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. Tirek can only use this against {@condition prone} creatures, or creatures two or more sizes smaller than him.

action.name: Horn Beam
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 8} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) force damage.

A centaur from a far off land who learned the ability to steal magic. He will not rest until all magic is his. This is his "base" form, and if he's able to get past Power level 4, he can become a society ending threat.

trait.name: Magic Absorption
entries: Tirek is immune to force damage, and succeeds on all saving throws from spells. When Tirek succeeds on a saving throw from a spell he regains HP equal to that spell's level.

trait.name: Building Power
entries: Whenever Tirek consumes a spell of 3rd level or greater via his Consume Magic ability, he builds a power level.
At Power level 1, his Strength increases to 21. At level 2, he can use his Horn Beam attack. At level 3, all of his stats become 21 and he becomes Huge sized. At level 4+, he needs a new stat block.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Tirek makes 2 attacks, either Punches or Horn Beams.

action.name: Consume Magic
entries: A creature within 5 ft. of Tirek must make a Charisma saving throw, {@dc 17}. On a Failure, they lose their highest level spell slot. Tirek regains HP equal to the level of the spell slot lost. If the spell slot was at least level 3, Tirek builds a power level. (See Building Power above)

action.name: Punch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Stomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. Tirek can only use this against {@condition prone} creatures, or creatures two or more sizes smaller than him.

action.name: Horn Beam
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 8} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) force damage.

A centaur from a far off land who learned the ability to steal magic. He will not rest until all magic is his. This is his "base" form, and if he's able to get past Power level 4, he can become a society ending threat.

monster.name: King Sombra, Shadow Knight

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Sombra is a 19th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 18}, {@hit 10} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following paladin spells prepared:

trait.name: Unholy Aura
entries: Unless he is {@condition incapacitated}, Sombra and undead or fiend creatures of his choice within 60 feet can add +4 to saving throws and ability checks. (These are already added to his saving throws above)

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Sombra makes three Unholy Avenger attacks.

action.name: Unholy Avenger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 1d10 + 8}) slashing damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Hellfire Orb (1/Day)
entries: Sombra launches a magical ball of fire from his armor that explodes at a point he can see within 120 feet of it. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw. The sphere spreads around corners. A creature takes 35 ({@damage 10d6}) fire damage and 35 ({@damage 10d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: Sombra adds 6 to his AC against weapon attacks until the end of turn.

variant.name: King Sombra, the Regicide
entries: In my campaign, Sombra was also an accomplished artificer, and his magical items gave him the following abilities.
Unholy Avenger: His Unholy Avenger sword does an extra 33 ({@damage 6d10}) necrotic damage to Alicorns.

Magic Armor. Sombra's warded armor made of Tartarean metal gives him advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects, and increases his AC by 1. If needed it can be donned or doffed as an action.
Access to Legendary Actions

legendary.name: Reactive Armor
entries: Can only be used if Sombra took damage on the turn before this is used. Sombra's Armor sends out a magical shockwave to a creature that dealt damage to him. The creature must make a {@dc 16} Dex save or take 11 ({@dice 2d10}) necrotic and 11 ({@damage 2d10}) lightning damage, and half that on a success. Sombra gains hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt.

legendary.name: Shadow Step Boots
entries: Sombra teleports to a location within 30 feet and makes an Unholy Avenger Attack.

legendary.name: Spell Absorb (costs 3 actions)
entries: Sombra casts Dispel Magic on himself or something he is carrying or wielding at 3rd level. If the magic is successfully dispelled, Sombra regains a use of the Hellfire Orb.

legendaryHeader: If using the Regicide variant, Sombra can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The sombra regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

entries: Shadow King of the Crystal Empire. Once a Paladin of the Alicorn who ruled the empire, for reasons unknown to Equestria, he rebelled and killed his alicorn Empress. After attacking his southern neighbor, The Alicorn Diarchs, Princesses Luna and Celestia put him down. But what is dead cannot die.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: Ahuizotl can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Grasping Tail
entries: Ahuizotl has expertise in Athletics, and can grapple up to three creatures at once.

action.name: Grapple
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h} 6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage and the target is {@condition grappled}. If damage from this attack reduces a target to 0 HP, that target is {@condition unconscious} and stabilized.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Grogar casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 19}):

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Grogar fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Grogar has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Grogar makes three Gore or Hornblast attacks. He also uses Frightful Presence.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d6 + 10}) piercing damage. If Grogar moved at least 10 feet straight toward the target immediately before the hit, the target takes an extra 16 ({@damage 3d10}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 25} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away and knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Hornblast
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 9} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 4d10 + 4}) force damage.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of Grogar's choice within 120 feet of him and aware of him must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A {@condition frightened} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. These later saves have disadvantage if Grogar is within line of sight of the creature.
If a creature succeeds on any of these saves or the effect ends on it, the creature is immune to Grogar's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

legendary.name: Hornblast Attack
entries: Grogar makes one Hornblast attack.

legendary.name: Charge (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Grogar moves up to his speed without provoking {@action opportunity attack||opportunity attacks}, then makes a Gore attack.

legendary.name: Summon Monster (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Grogar summons a simulacrum of a creature of CR6 or lower. This simulacrum has 1 hit point, and if it would take half damage from a spell or ability after succeeding a saving throw, it takes none instead. The simulacra fades after 24 hours.

Often called the Father of Monsters, Grogar ruled the lands that would become Equestria long before the tribal unification. He was defeated by a unicornian heroine, but supposedly the various monsters that live in Equestria trace their roots to this tyrant's rule.
